title: How the refurbishment of a large country home in the Cotswolds - and a 'major life change' for its owner - sparked a new career in interior design
text:
Stepping over the threshold of Lou Lewis's Georgian Cotswolds home, you might think that it was mid-renovation. Time-worn rooms ease into more recently decorated living and dining areas, in vibrant shades of camomile pink, apple green, cobalt blue and zesty orange.

The story of its current incarnation started when Lewis, 46, moved out of London eight years ago with her husband and children (Rosie, 16, Minnie, 14, and George, 10) to buy and renovate her former family home. Lewis's parents had spontaneously suggested that if the couple ever wanted to buy their 19-room property, they would be interested in selling, to downsize to a smaller house in the village.
